title: Large-Scale Advanced English Education Design Utilizing Digital Tools

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in secondary English education and basic digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: Re-Training Program for In-Service Secondary English Teachers in Smartphone-Centric, Technology-Constrained Settings: 12-Week Course with Biweekly 2-Hour Offline Sessions

learning_goals: Cultivation of the ability to design learner-participatory English classes using smartphone-based collaboration tools (Google Docs, Padlet)

Learners can develop over 10 assessment items in the service/customer response field using Quizlet and ClassKast, and achieve an 'Excellent' rating in 4 out of 5 criteria of the 'Assessment Item Suitability Rubric' from at least 2 out of 3 peer evaluators.

Instructional designers possess the operational competency to design real-time formative assessments at least twice a month using Kahoot! and Mentimeter, achieving an 80%+ participant response rate and assessment item appropriateness (4+ out of 5 points based on rubric criteria).

Learners design a 3-stage (planning-execution-evaluation) pedagogical approach to enhance digital literacy based on the TPACK model (integration of technological, pedagogical, and content knowledge), apply it at least twice in public/nonprofit educational settings, and achieve an average participant satisfaction survey score of 4.0+/5.0.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
